item.title: Elly add a quote by Michael Cunningham
item.description: "Perhaps, in the extravagance of youth, we give away our devotions easily and all but arbitrarily, on the mistaken assumption that weâ€™ll always have more to give." -- Michael Cunningham

item.title: Elly add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "If I looked in the mirror someday and saw no dark circles under my eyes, I would probably look better. I just wouldn't look like me. " -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Elly add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I myself am made entirely of flaws, stitched together with good intentions." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Elly add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I am prone to envy. It is one of my three default emotions, the others being greed and rage. I have also experienced compassion and generosity, but only fleetingly and usually while drunk, so I have little memory." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Elly add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "But truth be told, I'm not as dour-looking as I would like. I'm stuck with this round, sweetie-pie face, tiny heart-shaped lips, the daintiest dimples, and apple cheeks so rosy I appear in a perpetual blush. At five foot four, I barely squeak by average height. And then there's my voice: straight out of second grade. I come across so young and innocent and harmless that I have been carded for buying maple syrup. Tourists feel more safe approaching me for directions, telemarketers always ask if my mother is home, and waitresses always, always call me 'Hon." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Elly add a quote by Dave Eggers
item.description: "Why do we pursue information that we know will never leave our heads?" -- Dave Eggers

item.title: Elly add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "I believe the sin of covetise is that pang of resentment you may feel when even the people you love best have what you want and don't have." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Elly add a quote by Amy Hempel
item.description: "It is possible to imagine a person so entirely that the image resists attempts to dislodge it." -- Amy Hempel

item.title: Elly add a quote by Frank Bruni
item.description: "I suppose there are people who can pass up free guacamole, but they're either allergic to avocado or too joyless to live." -- Frank Bruni

item.title: Elly add a quote by David Elliot Cohen
item.description: "I realized then that if I could teach my children only one or two basic principles, tolerance would be one of them." -- David Elliot Cohen

item.title: Elly add a quote by Joan Didion
item.description: "Time is the school in which we learn" -- Joan Didion

item.title: Elly add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "By the way, when Oprah Winfrey is suggesting you may have overextended yourself, you need to examine your fucking life." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Elly add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "When you watched Sanford and Son you didn't want to have sex with everybody you saw just Grady." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Elly add a quote by Sara Gruen
item.description: "With a secret like that, at some point the secret itself becomes irrelevant. The fact that you kept it does not." -- Sara Gruen

item.title: Elly add a quote by Shilpi Somaya Gowda
item.description: "At some point, the family you create is more important than the one you were born into." -- Shilpi Somaya Gowda

item.title: Elly add a quote by Amy Krouse Rosenthal
item.description: "I am a slow reader, and fast eater; I wish it were the other way around." -- Amy Krouse Rosenthal

item.title: Elly add a quote by Richard Russo
item.description: "My mother had more than once remarked that my father was one of the war's casualties, that the Sam Hall who came back wasn't the one who left, the one she'd fallen in love with. I didn't doubt that she believed this certain truth, or even that it was true, after a fashion. But it was a nice way of ignoring another simple truth--that people changed, with or without wars, and that we sometimes don't know people as well as we think we do, that the worst errors in judgment often result from imagining we understand what has escaped us entirely." -- Richard Russo

item.title: Elly add a quote by Mindy Kaling
item.description: "A remarkable thing about me is that the time that elapses between a sad thought and a flood of tears is three or four seconds." -- Mindy Kaling

item.title: Elly add a quote by Richard Yates
item.description: "He couldn't even tell whether he was angry or contrite, whether it was forgiveness he wanted or the power to forgive." -- Richard Yates
